item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Math is still catching up to the genius of Ramanujan (195 points | 108 comments)
2. LTESniffer: An Open-Source LTE Downlink/Uplink Eavesdropper (53 points | 2 comments)
3. First images from Euclid are in (261 points | 89 comments)
4. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (230 points | 91 comments)
5. Building a Game with the Real Engine (16 points | discuss)
6. Scalene: A high-performance, high-precision CPU, GPU, memory profiler for Python (61 points | 5 comments)
7. Transitioning the Use of Cryptographic Algorithms and Key Lengths (52 points | 20 comments)
8. Learning to Learn (15 points | 2 comments)
9. Show HN: Data Formulator – AI-powered data visualization from Microsoft Research (47 points | 2 comments)
10. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (126 points | 58 comments)
11. Thought experiments that fray the fabric of space-time (69 points | 79 comments)
12. Show HN: Epublifier – scrape pages (books, manuals) for offline reading (257 points | 40 comments)
13. Are you tasty to mosquitoes? Study offers clues into when and why they bite (10 points | 11 comments)
14. Mind Wandering: More than a Bad Habit (2018) [pdf] (55 points | 21 comments)
15. New discovery reveals how diatoms capture CO2 so effectively (40 points | 6 comments)
16. Apple's AirPods Pro hearing health features are as good as they sound (75 points | 35 comments)
17. Wired's Attack on Privacy (51 points | 13 comments)
18. Ask HN: In 2024 what's the best way to manage contacts? (33 points | 24 comments)
19. World-first therapy using donor cells sends autoimmune diseases into remission (21 points | 4 comments)
20. Transformers Utilization in Chart Understanding: A Review of Advances and Future (6 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: Floating point arithmetic types in C++ for any size and any base (65 points | 23 comments)
22. Please do not write below the line (281 points | 228 comments)
23. Egypt declared malaria-free after 100-year effort (523 points | 55 comments)
24. IOCCC Flight Simulator (2010) (150 points | 22 comments)
25. ByteDance sacks intern for sabotaging AI project (137 points | 159 comments)
26. Scientists working to decode birdsong (138 points | 124 comments)
27. Workaround Clang v15 AArch64 miscompile that affects parallel collection (60 points | 7 comments)
28. Morsle – A daily Morse code challenge (109 points | 35 comments)
29. Waking up science's sleeping beauties (2023) (60 points | 25 comments)
30. Vimium – The Hacker's Browser (6 points | 2 comments)
